messages.title: Our pledges to you
messages.content: Security at work, A secure NHS and social care, A National Education Service, Give taxpayers more control, An equal society

keyPolicies.policyDescription: We will give people stronger employment rights and end zero hours contracts.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A secure NHS and social care
keyPolicies.policyDescription: We will integrate social care and healthcare so that it works for disabled and elderly people. We will ensure parity for mental health services.
From birth, right through to adulthood, we will implement universal childcare and support adult training so that everyone has affordable, progressive education.
We will bring our public and local services back under democratic control, expand public bus networks and return the railways to public ownership.
We will tackle inequality, violence and discrimination and guarantee the rights of EU citizens in Britain.
During 2016, A&E waiting times at Stoke Mandeville Hospital breached the four hour limit for 10 months.
A vote for Labour is a vote against school funding cuts.
We will put the economy first, prioritise the single market and customs union, protect workers' rights and the environment.

community.content: A vote for Labour is a vote against school funding cuts.

leaflet.personalStatement: I live in Chesham, and since I moved here seven years ago I’ve been very active in local politics. I am delighted to have been selected as Labour’s candidate in this General Election as I believe that Chesham and Amersham is ready for a change. I want to be that change and represent the voice of the many.

politicalExperience.role: Labour candidate for Chesham and Amersham, Stay at home parent, Freelance coordinator
politicalExperience.achievements: Organised the local Stronger In campaign, campaigned for a safe, inclusive, and welcoming society

endorsements.endorser: Tim Starkey, Barrister and former Lib Dem parliamentary candidate
endorsements.endorsement: During the referendum campaign I saw first hand how Nina managed to inspire people from all parties and none to unite in campaigning for the Remain cause. She would do a great job of standing up for everyone in our constituency.

quotes.text: During the referendum campaign I saw first hand how Nina managed to inspire people from all parties and none to unite in campaigning for the Remain cause. She would do a great job of standing up for everyone in our constituency.
quotes.source: Tim Starkey, Barrister and former Lib Dem parliamentary candidate

examples: During 2016, A&E waiting times at Stoke Mandeville Hospital breached the four hour limit for 10 months.
Earlier this year parents all over Buckinghamshire received a letter from headteachers highlighting the unfair funding formula disadvantaging their schools.
I want to be that change and represent the voice of the many.
A vote for Labour is a vote against school funding cuts.
I live in Chesham, and since I moved here seven years ago I’ve been very active in local politics.
Are you happy for the Conservatives to be in government when they are mismanaging our services so badly?
We will put the economy first, prioritise the single market and customs union, protect workers' rights and the environment.
A vote for Labour is a vote against school funding cuts.
We will integrate social care and healthcare so that it works for disabled and elderly people.
